title: Community regression: Channels stay highlighted when they are not selected

milestone.description:
**1. Finish anything that wasn't completed in the previous 0.14 cycle**

- And fix bugs as usual. We need to keep tech. debt at a roughly fixed level as we grow out functionality, can't let it accumulate! ;-)

**2. Complete initial airdrop functionality**
- Airdrop history screens
- Ability to airdrop based on in-Community activity (No. of msg, No. msg in time range, joining a community, length of community membership)  Ability to combine multiple attributes into an airdrop
- Ability to token gate airdrops
- Live airdrop gas estimation when setting up airdrop

**3. Token import functionality**
- Ability for a community Owner to import ERC-20 and NFT tokens, to later be airdropped or retailed

**4. Admin functionality enhancements**
- Ability to mark a token gated channel as 'hidden', only visible to community members with the requisite tokens
- optional service to once a month auto-kick all members who haven't been online for between 30 and 60 days (e.g. auto-kick members whose profile information like Name, Avatar, etc... can no longer be fetched)

**5. QR scanner**
- Needed for private key transfer
- Ethereum key QRs (send modal triggered)
- User Share URL in a QR (opens user profile dialogue) 
- Community and Channel inside Community URL in QRs (takes user to Community or Channel in Community)

**6. Chat functionality enhancements**
- Introduce @channel as a new type of global @ mention.  This @ mention only @ mention's everyone who has posted a message in a channel in the last 30 days 

**7. Binaries over Waku**
- Improve transfer of binaries over waku via splitting into chunks https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/9923
- Posting of small files (max size somewhere in the region of 1 to 2mb).  Requires above item before going live


**--- Wallet Team ---**

1. Total balance graphs for 'All accounts' and each individual account

2. Advanced transaction signing

body:
Version: 0.13.0-rc.6
OS: Windows 10

***
Preconditions: Download 0.13 - rc.6 and restore Status account from seed phrase. Navigate to a community the user is the owner of. 

<ins>Steps to reproduce:</ins>

1. Click on a channel and move it up a little bit without changing the channel position. 

<ins>What currently incorrectly happens:</ins>

2. The channel above the channel that was selected and moved becomes highlighted.  
The channel that was highlighted remains highlighted when a mouse is not hovering over it and after it is no longer selected. You can do this to multiple channels. 
When a user clicks and drags a channel across the previously selected and highlighted channel(s), the highlight disappears. 

<ins>What is supposed to happen:</ins>

2. Channels should only be highlighted when:
- a mouse is hovering over it (light grey)
- the channel has been selected (slightly darker grey)


<ins>Other information</ins>
This screencast better demonstrates the bug -  


https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/assets/124154641/b9bbe5b9-2567-412f-8802-7e1982d0136e
@caybro you put the messenger-team label, but I'm not sure if that's correct. This seems like a UI issue. The dragged state probably doesn't remove itself correctly or something?
